author: demiurgos_23
content: when will Eips : [4200, 4750, 6200, 633] include the opcodes swap, because now we have MCOPY, TLOAD , TSTORE occupying the same opcode as the static jumps opcodes

author: _shemnon
content: To complicate things, I think we need to use more than the E block if we want to include conditional callf and jumpf.  And we need to reserve room for a possible extdatacopy.

author: _shemnon
content: My initial thoughts were EOF container dependant opcodes go in the E block (callf, datacopy) whereas opcodes with immediate arguments but don't interact with the EOF container go in the D block (RJUMP, SWAP and DUP).

author: _shemnon
content: Working on EIP-6780 (selfdestruct) and I think two clarifications are needed.  Please take a look.  My preferences are weak, either solution is find by me.  https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-6780-deactivate-selfdestruct-except-where-it-occurs-in-the-same-transaction-in-which-a-contract-was-created/13539/17
